channel.title: /biz/ Ticker Threads
channel.description: Ticker mention threads with inline replies

item.title: [NOT] Welcome to /biz/ - Business & Finance — 1 replies
item.content:encoded:
[NOT] Welcome to /biz/ - Business & Finance

Open thread • Replies: 1 • Updated: 2025-04-25 20:50 UTC

OP

This board is for the discussion of topics related to business, economics, financial markets, securities, currencies (including cryptocurrencies), commodities, etc -- as well as topics relating to starting and running a business.

Discussions of government policy must be strictly limited to economic policies (fiscal and monetary). Discussions of a political nature should be posted on >>>/pol/. Global Rule 3 is also obviously in effect.

Note: /biz/ is NOT a place for ADVERTISING or SOLICITING. Do NOT use it to promote your business, ventures, or anything you may have an interest in. Anything that looks remotely like advertising or soliciting will be removed. Begging/asking (including tipping) for cryptocurrencies or asking for money/capital is also strictly forbidden.

Replies (oldest → newest)

60278993
Check the catalog before posting a new thread!Reply to existing threads about a topic instead of starting a new one. Mods will delete obvious duplicate threads and spam without notice.

I actually don't think it even makes sense to expect Lemonis to do anything other than to deny what is happening. To even write such a post is actually stupid.
The truth is the only thing that matters is the CUSIP. If BBBYQ shares were dead and gone, the warrants would have been issued using Overstock/BYON/BBBY's CUSIP. But they do not. They have BBBYQs CUSIP. This is the most jarring fact we have to go on right now. It proves on a 100% proven factual basis that BBBYQ reverse merged with BBBYQ. It already happened. The "Butterfly" in DK Butterfly was all about splitting off the shell so that the BK protections could be maximized while Lemonis continued the operations. Once we are done with CH11 the operations and the shell will be disclosed to have recombined. We know this because it already happened. The CUSIP would not be on BBBY's warrants otherwise.
These warrants were released on the same date as GME's warrants. GME's CEO is apart of the BBBYQ CH11 process.
Towelkings will inherit MOASS. This is bigger than GME.

This goes to show you just how dumb and disingenuous the silly shillies are. You can ask Goldberg whatever the hell you want but he is not obligated to give you a truthful answer when M&A is involved. He wouldn't tell you so this is completely useless.
This still does not solve the CUSIP Conundrum. Words only get you so far, but right here right now in 2026 there are open Bed Bath and Beyond stores and the company that operates them is not even using the Overstock/BYON/BBBY CUSIP. They issued new securities in October using BBBYQs CUSIP.
It's already proven 100% fact that a reverse merger of the BBBYQ shell has already occurred with BBBY. There is zero counterargument.
Overstock, BYON and BBBY all kept them same CUSIP. So why now does it suddenly switch? Occams Razor solves the puzzle: BBBYQ shell reverse merger has already occured and the details are not in any known docket.
BBBY mystery has been solved by yours truly.

item.title: [AAPL COVID GOOG MSFT] Writing on the wall — 2 replies
item.content:encoded:
[AAPL COVID GOOG MSFT] Writing on the wall

Open thread • Replies: 2 • Updated: 2026-02-15 18:25 UTC

OP

By now we all know the show's over (referring to the AI bubble).

There isn't going to be a grand finale moon pump in equities. It's just going to start crumbling, and right now. I think everyone who's been active in this market for the past few years can see this.

The question is where do we hide. Most people are suggesting one of the following:
>1. Equal weight S&P
>2. Cyclical rotation
>3. European rotation
>4. Commodity hoarding (you've missed out by now)
>5. Just thugging it out

However I think the collapse of the AI bubble will take the wind out of the sails of all other asset classes. The EU trade has worked quite well recently, but even they are trading at about 17.5x P/E. Hardly cheap. That shit could quite easily drop 30% and not break long term historic norms.

Commodities also usually drop during a recession. Will the bubble pop cause a recession as well? Probably at least a little one.

>5.
Life is finite. Have fun being poor and underwater for years whilst more of your best years are wasted. This isn't going to be another V shape recovery like COVID. This is going to be a very painful and expensive lost decade.

My opinion is that at the moment, it's probably worth taking inflation on the chin for a couple of years and holding cash, until something extraordinary happens. We are obviously teetering on a broad market decline with nowhere to hide.

Final point:
>MSFT and Nvidia are the most fucked of all
>GOOG has absorbed the ongoing slow collapse of the other AI stocks. They're collapsing into GOOG, which has held up the S&P and masked the decline, but eventually GOOG will go down too. And then the world will know about it.
>When GOOG decline triggers the broad sell off, risk assets will crater.
>Tesla is another trillion dollar black hole just waiting to implode.
>AAPL isn't exposed to AI, but has it's own stagnation problem

The first dominos have already fallen.

Replies (oldest → newest)

>>61857557
